alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 6:49AM MDT until April 13 at 7:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Great Falls MT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Montana... Battle Creek near Chinook affecting Blaine County. For the Battle Creek...including Chinook...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast by this afternoon. * WHERE...Battle Creek near Chinook. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 12.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 AM MDT Wednesday was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.4 feet this afternoon. It will then slowly fall to below flood stage by 6 AM MDT. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.4 feet on 04/06/1952. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued as necessary this afternoon before 315 PM MDT.this evening at 600 PM MDT.
